channel.title: Starting armor in Delta
channel.description: Is there a way to have it so that when someone makes a new account they start with armor equipped, not in inventory. In player.java I don't have the "giving player unique look" thing. I'm using delta.

item.title: Starting armor in Delta
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

[quote=“Mental Piracy, post:7, topic:326503”]Those are delta… just do playerEquipment[playerChest] == (itemid)

Now i am willing to continue to help you, but you have to understand what I am telling you is true and you have to actually listen to it, instead of saying its wrong the playerEquipment is delta, but you may have to use this method to add them

setEquipment(itemid, 1, playerChest);
I remember something like that. Just replace item id and playerChest with the other ones i posted for whichever piece you want.[/quote]

where do i put that?

Read full topic

item.title: Starting armor in Delta
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

Those are delta… just do playerEquipment[playerChest] == (itemid)

Now i am willing to continue to help you, but you have to understand what I am telling you is true and you have to actually listen to it, instead of saying its wrong the playerEquipment is delta, but you may have to use this method to add them

setEquipment(itemid, 1, playerChest);
I remember something like that. Just replace item id and playerChest with the other ones i posted for whichever piece you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting armor in Delta
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

I don’t want it to spawn in the inventory, I want it to spawn ON them. I don’t have…

playerEquipment[playerShield] == (Item id you want equiped)
playerEquipment[playerHat]
playerEquipment[playerCape]
playerEquipment[playerAmulet]
playerEquipment[playerWeapon]
playerEquipment[playerChest]
playerEquipment[playerLegs]
playerEquipment[playerHands]
playerEquipment[playerFeet]

…because I’m using Delta.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting armor in Delta
item.dc:creator: @Nubz Nubz
item.description:
@Nubz wrote:

[quote=“Mental Piracy, post:4, topic:326503”]In your starter area set
playerEquipment[playerShield] == (Item id you want equiped)
playerEquipment[playerHat]
playerEquipment[playerCape]
playerEquipment[playerAmulet]
playerEquipment[playerWeapon]
playerEquipment[playerChest]
playerEquipment[playerLegs]
playerEquipment[playerHands]
playerEquipment[playerFeet][/quote]Oh I though he meant the items you start with

Read full topic

In your starter area set
playerEquipment[playerShield] == (Item id you want equiped)

playerEquipment[playerAmulet]

item.title: Starting armor in Delta
item.dc:creator: @Nubz Nubz
item.description:
@Nubz wrote:

[quote=“Pure Demons, post:2, topic:326503”]Search in Player.java one of the starter armor ID’s.[/quote]Wrong, sir.
Go in client.java and search this:
if(starter == 0){
And then where you see the addItem(1291, 1);
addItem(1171, 1);
addItem(841, 1);
addItem(882, 100);
addItem(380, 100);
addItem(995, 10000);
Edit that.

Read full topic
